alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Quay County; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 7:51PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN SAN MIGUEL...SOUTHEASTERN HARDING...NORTHEASTERN QUAY AND SOUTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM MDT... At 751 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Hayden to 11 miles southeast of Mosquero. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Amistad, Hayden, and Rosebud. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Quay County; Union County
